column2: A valid testamentary will in Nevada requires that 1) the testator was at least 18 years old, 2) the testator had testamentary intent and capacity, 3) the testator signed the will, 4) the signing was in the presence of two non-interested witnesses, and 5) two witnesses sign the will in the testator’s presence.
A valid holographic will in Nevada requires that 1) all essential terms are in the testator’s writing, 2) the will is signed, and 3) the will is dated.
If a testator died intestate, or without a valid will, Nevada has laws dealing with a surviving spouse share, and surviving family share.
